1.text: Wine is mocking, strong drink is noisy: and every one going astray by it will not be wise.

2.text: The terror of the king growling as the young lion: he overflowing against him sinned against his soul.

3.text: Honor to a man ceasing from strife: and every foolish one will be irritated.

4.text: The slothful one reproaching will not work: he shall ask in harvest, and nothing.

5.text: Deep waters are counsel in the heart of man; and a man of understanding will draw it out.

6.text: The multitude of man will call each his mercy: and a man of faithfulness who shall find?

7.text: The just one going about in his integrity: his sons happy after him.

8.text: The king shall sit upon the throne of judgment scattering with his eyes all evil.

9.text: Who shall say, I cleansed my heart; I was pure from my sin?

10.text: A stone and stone, an ephah and ephah, an abomination of Jehovah, also they two.

11.text: Also a youth shall be known by his doings, if pure and straight his work.

12.text: The hearing ear and the seeing eye, Jehovah made, also them two.

13.text: Thou shalt not love sleep lest thou shalt be dispossessed: open wide thine eyes, being filled with bread.

14.text: Evil, evil, he buying will say: and departing to him, and then he will boast.

15.text: There is gold and a multitude of pearls: and a precious vessel the lips of knowledge.

16.text: Take his garment that became surety for a stranger: and bind him by a pledge for strange women.

17.text: Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man; and afterward his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

18.text: The purpose shall be prepared by counsel, and with guidance make war.

19.text: He revealing a secret going about tale-bearing: and thou shalt not intermingle with him embracing his lips.

20.text: He cursing his father and his mother, his lamp shall go out in the midst of darkness.

21.text: An inheritance greedily gotten in the beginning; and its latter state shall not be.

22.text: Thou shalt not say, I will requite evil; wait for Jehovah, he will save to thee.

23.text: An abomination of Jehovah stone and stone; and the balance of deceit is not good.

24.text: From Jehovah manâ€™s steps; and how shall man understand his way?

25.text: The snare of man swallowing down the holy thing, after the vows for seeking.

26.text: A wise king scatters the unjust, and he will turn back a wheel over them.

27.text: The light of Jehovah is the breath of man, searching all the chambers of the belly.

28.text: Mercy and truth shall guard the king: and his throne he upheld in mercy.

29.text: The glory of young men their strength: and the ornament of old men gray hair.

30.text: The joining of a wound will cleanse against evil: and blows the chambers of the belly.
